channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Salient, an AI loan processing startup valued at $500 million, grew ARR to $25 million in two years
item.description: Salient cofounder Ari Malik built AI to automate loan servicing, turning collections calls into a high-growth business now valued around $500 million.

item.title: Frontier Firm AI Initiative Aims To Redefine AI-Driven Enterprises
item.description: Harvard and Microsoft are studying how global enterprises can become human-led, agent-operated “Frontier Firms” through real-world experiments in orga...

item.title: Lovable hits $6.6 billion valuation as its CEO says it wants to be ‘the last piece of software’ companies ever buy
item.description: The Swedish startup raised $330 million as enterprises race to adopt AI-built software.

item.title: Inflation remained elevated in November as Fed considers pausing interest rate cuts
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics released the November consumer price index which showed that CPI inflation remained well above the Federal Reserve's 2%...

item.title: Labor secretary downplays warning signs, insists job market is ‘strengthening’ despite rising unemployment
item.description: Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer defends the rising unemployment rate of 4.6% as a positive sign that more Americans are seeking jobs under the Tru...

item.title: The Best Cinema Formats For ‘Avatar: Fire And Ash’
item.description: With terms such as 3D, 4K, HFR. HDR knowing where's best to see 'Avatar: Fire and Ash is more challenging that taming an Ikran. Eywa says read this ar...

item.title: The AI efficiency illusion: why cutting 1.1 million jobs will stifle, not scale, your strategy
item.description: The canary in the coal mine for the broader economy is the crisis facing Black women.

item.title: ‘This is a wacky number’: economists cry foul as new government data assumes zero housing inflation in surprising November drop
item.description: The culprit, several economists say, is the extended government shutdown.

item.title: Trump says $1,776 ‘warrior dividends’ were made possible partly by tariff revenue, which still lags $100 billion behind what the White House expected
item.description: The one-time check to military personnel will cost the administration $2.6 billion.

item.title: The Art Of Board Membering: Lessons From The Board Room
item.description: Lessons From The Board Room

item.title: Season 2 Of ‘Fallout’ Set 3 Rotten Tomatoes Records
item.description: Fallout season 2 has already set three Rotten Tomatoes records for its genre after just one episode.

item.title: ‘Invisible’ Material Could Make Windows Super Insulating
item.description: Colorado team develop a new form of silicone that is more transparent than window glass, and a better thermal insulator than materials used to constru...

item.title: Nasdaq leading stocks higher in final hour; Dow, S&P poised to snap losing runs
Nvidia and other chip stocks rise — but the AI trade may not be back for good
How investors can take advantage of a quirky midterm election cycle
Nasdaq closes sharply higher, Dow and S&P 500 snap 4-day losing streaks

PayPal plans to launch bank serving small businesses around the US
item.description: PayPal files with Utah and the FDIC to launch PayPal Bank, an industrial loan company offering small business lending and FDIC-insured savings account...

item.title: Musk predicts AI will create 'universal high income' and make saving money unnecessary
item.description: Elon Musk dismisses Trump savings accounts, claiming AI will create "universal high income" and eliminate poverty, making saving unnecessary.

item.title: FDA announces recall of frozen dessert pints over possible 'small stones'
item.description: The FDA announced a voluntary recall of non-dairy frozen dessert pints sold at stores nationwide over the potential presence of small stones.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
